checkers
Class Grid

java.lang.Object
  checkers.Grid

public class Grid
extends java.lang.Object

Grid class, creates a two dimensional array of type "piece" Also performs functions to update, check validity etc.

Constructor Summary
Grid(Grid another)
          Creates a grid based on another grid (calls clone() method on the other grid to do so)
Grid(int numRows, int numCols)
          Creates a grid with the specified rows and columns for pieces to exist on.

Method Detail

update

public void update()
Updates locations of all pieces within the grid. Necessary to redraw the grid

getPieces

public java.util.ArrayList<Piece> getPieces()
Returns all non-null pieces that are present in the logical grid. Note: Logical Grid is not the same as GUI grid.

Returns:
ArrayList of all non-null pieces in the grid

getPieces

public java.util.ArrayList<Piece> getPieces(java.awt.Color c)
Returns an ArrayList of all non-null pieces of given color in the logical grid. Note: Logical Grid is not the same as GUI grid.

Parameters:
c - Color of the pieces you want returned
Returns:
Returns ArrayList of all pieces of given color c

getKings

public java.util.ArrayList<King> getKings(java.awt.Color c)
Returns an ArrayList of all Kings of given color in the logical grid. Note: Logical Grid is not the same as GUI grid.

Parameters:
c - Color of kings to be returned
Returns:
Arraylist of all kings of given color.

isPieceAt

public boolean isPieceAt(Location L)
isValid function, also checks if there is piece at specified location Returns true if there is a piece at specified location Returns false if there is no piece at specified location OR specified location is invalid

Parameters:
L - Location to be checked
Returns:
True if there is a piece at specified location. False if there is no piece at specified location OR specified location is invalid.

getAllValidLocs

public java.util.LinkedList<Location> getAllValidLocs(java.awt.Color c)
Returns all valid locations for pieces of Color c. Essentially calls getValidLocations() on all pieces and puts them in one LinkedList

Parameters:
c - Color of pieces you want to find
Returns:
LinkedList of all valid locations for all non-null pieces.

getAllJumps

public java.util.LinkedList<Location> getAllJumps(java.awt.Color c)
Returns all jump locations for all non-null pieces of color c. Essentially calls getJumpLocations() on all pieces and puts them in one LinkedList

Parameters:
c - color you want jump locations of
Returns:
LinkedList of all valid locations for all non-null pieces.
